federal_dec_nodes.summary_html: CPS **screens out** a report (no investigation) or closes as **unfounded** after minimal review. Federal law (CAPTA) conditions funding on operating screening criteria and recordkeeping; federal reviews (CFSR) assess decision quality.
federal_dec_nodes.authority_html:
- **CAPTA (42 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 5101‚Äì5116)** ‚Äî screening & intake system requirements  
- **CFSR Regulations (45 CFR Part 1355)** ‚Äî federal performance/quality review of state screening and responses
federal_dec_nodes.decision_basis: Report does not meet statutory or policy criteria for investigation; insufficient information; outside jurisdiction; not child maltreatment.
federal_dec_nodes.due_process_hooks: Recordkeeping; notice per state policy; ability to re-report with new facts.

federal_dec_nodes.summary_html: CPS **accepts** a report for **investigation/assessment**. CAPTA sets the floor for investigation procedures; CFSR evaluates timeliness, safety, and decision quality.
federal_dec_nodes.authority_html:
- **CAPTA (42 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 5101‚Äì5116)** ‚Äî investigation standards tied to funding  
- **CFSR (45 CFR Part 1355)** ‚Äî timeliness & response conformity indicators
federal_dec_nodes.decision_basis: Allegations meet state statutory definitions or policy thresholds for child maltreatment; safety factors present.
federal_dec_nodes.due_process_hooks: Notice to parents/guardians as required by state law; initiation timelines; documentation in SACWIS/CCWIS.

federal_dec_nodes.summary_html: Agency makes a **substantiated (founded)** finding of abuse/neglect. This decision often unlocks **court petitions**, **service mandates**, and **federal reporting** duties.
federal_dec_nodes.authority_html:
- **CAPTA (42 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 5101‚Äì5116)** ‚Äî definitions floor; data & record requirements  
- **CFSR (45 CFR Part 1355)** ‚Äî outcomes & safety performance reviews
federal_dec_nodes.decision_basis: Evidence meets the state‚Äôs standard for substantiation (often preponderance).
federal_dec_nodes.due_process_hooks: Notice of finding; appeal/review rights per state law; registry listing rules; confidentiality constraints.

federal_dec_nodes.summary_html: Agency decides to **remove a child immediately** due to **imminent danger** prior to a court order. Federal law (ASFA/IV-E) requires later **court findings** on reasonable efforts; constitutional limits (due process; search/seizure) apply.
federal_dec_nodes.authority_html:
- **ASFA / SSA Title IV-E (42 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 670‚Äì679c)** ‚Äî reasonable-efforts findings; permanency timelines  
- **CFSR (45 CFR Part 1355)** ‚Äî monitors safety & removal decision quality
federal_dec_nodes.decision_basis: Specific, articulable facts indicate imminent threat of serious harm; exigency prevents obtaining a warrant first.
federal_dec_nodes.due_process_hooks: Prompt judicial review/hearing; reasonable-efforts findings; notice to parties; counsel rights under state law.

federal_dec_nodes.summary_html: Agency **files a court petition** to open a **dependency** (or similar) case. Federal funding frameworks (IV-E/ASFA) link court oversight, reasonable-efforts findings, and permanency timelines to downstream actions.
federal_dec_nodes.authority_html:
- **ASFA / SSA Title IV-E** ‚Äî court findings; timelines; permanency planning  
- **CFSR (45 CFR Part 1355)** ‚Äî federal review of court/agency performance measures
federal_dec_nodes.decision_basis: Evidence supports filing requirements under state juvenile/dependency code; safety/neglect/abuse grounds alleged.
federal_dec_nodes.due_process_hooks: Right to counsel (state-provided); service of process; adjudication timelines; discovery rules per state law.

federal_dec_nodes.summary_html: Agency chooses **Differential Response (DR)**/**Alternative Response**: engage **services without court petition** when safety permits. FFPSA and IV-B/IV-E prevention funding support voluntary, front-end help to avert removals.
federal_dec_nodes.authority_html:
- **Family First Prevention Services Act (FFPSA)** ‚Äî prevention services framework under IV-E  
- **SSA Title IV-B & IV-E (42 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 620‚Äì629m; 670‚Äì679c)** ‚Äî service funding & case-plan requirements  
- **CFSR (45 CFR Part 1355)** ‚Äî assesses safety/permanency outcomes in DR systems
federal_dec_nodes.decision_basis: Safety can be managed without court; family agrees to services; risk level appropriate for DR.
federal_dec_nodes.due_process_hooks: Informed consent; voluntary case plans; ability to decline; documentation for oversight.
